column2: Southern Nevada Culinary and Bartenders Pension Plan
column3: UNITE HERE Northwest Pension Trust Fund
column4: San Francisco Culinary, Bartenders and Service Employees Pension Plan
column5: Sacramento Independent Hotel, Restaurant and Tavern Employees Pension Plan

column3: Northwest Administrators, Inc. (NWA) (Effective Oct 1, 2018). Previously Welfare & Pension Administration Service, Inc.

column2: Automatic on the first day contributions are made/required, provided you have 300 Hours of Service during the Plan Year.
column3: Automatic on the first day contributions are required by a CBA.
column4: First of the month following completion of 3 months of Employer Contributions made within a Plan Year.
column5: Earlier of: (a) 1st of month after 5 calendar months of contributions in a Plan Year; or (b) June/Dec 1 after 1,000 Hours of Service in 12 months.

column2:
**5 Years:** If working in Covered Employment on/after Jan 1, 1997.
**10 Years:** If no work on/after Jan 1, 1997.
column3: **5 Years:** 1,000 hours of Covered Employment equals 1 year.
column4:
**5 Years:** If at least 1 hour of service on/after April 1, 1998 (without permanent break).
**10 Years:** Required prior to April 1, 1998.
column5:
**5 Years:** If worked 1+ hour in Covered Employment on/after June 1, 1999.
**10 Years:** If participation ended prior to June 1, 1999.

column2:
**1 Year Credit:** 1,500+ hours (1989-1999); 1,200+ hours (post-2000).
**Partial Credit:** Granted for hours between 300 and max threshold.
column3:
**1 Year Credit:** 1,000+ hours.
**Partial Credit:** Granted in 1/5 year increments (e.g., 400-549 hours = 1/5 year). Max 1 year credit per Plan Year.
column4: **1 Year Credit:** Based on monthly contributions. 12 months of contributions = 1 year. No credit for less than 3 months contribution participation in a Plan Year (after 1986).
column5:
**1 Year Vesting Credit:** 1,000 hours or contributions for 9 months.
**Future Service Credit:** 1,000 hours or 9 months contributions (post-1975). Partial credit for 300-999 hours (post-1996).

column2:
**Age 62:** With 5 years Pension Credit (if worked on/after Jan 1, 1997).
**Age 65:** With 5 years participation/credit under "Participation Rule".
column3: **Age 65:** With 5 years of service (or 5th anniversary of participation).
column4: **Age 65:** With 5 years Vesting Service (active on/after April 1, 1998) or 5th anniversary of participation.
column5: **Age 65:** Or 5th anniversary of participation after Jan 1, 1988 (active June 1, 1999 or later).

column2:
**Age 55:** With 5 years Pension Credit (if worked on/after Jan 1, 1997).
**Age 55:** With 10 years Pension Credit (if no work after 1996 but worked after 1993).
column3:
**Age 55:** With 5 years Pension Credit (active on/after Jan 1, 1997).
**Age 55:** With 10 years Pension Credit (if no work after 1996).
column4:
**Age 62:** With 10 years Vesting Service.
**Oakland Plan Participants:** Age 55 with 10 years Vesting Service (for benefits accrued pre-July 1, 2012).
column5:
**Age 55:** With 10 years Past/Future Service (at least 1 year Future).
**Age 55:** With 5 Vesting Years (if active on/after June 1, 1996).

column2:
Reduced 0.75% per month for ages 60 to 62.
Reduced additional 0.50% per month for ages 55 to 60.
column3:
**Active:** No change stated in SMM.
**Terminated Vested:** 2013 Rehabilitation Plan changed factors for those with <400 hours in 2011-2013 (e.g., Age 55 factor reduced from 40% to 35%).
column4:
**Normal:** Reduced by 0.6% for each month younger than 65.
**Oakland Plan:** Reduced by 0.5% for each month younger than Normal Retirement Age.
column5: Reduced by 0.5% for each month the Early Retirement Date precedes Normal Retirement Date.

column2:
Total/Permanent Disability.
At least 5 years Pension Credit.
Worked 300 hours in year of disability or year prior.
column3:
Total/Permanent Disability.
10 years service (1 year future service).
**Restriction:** 2013 Rehab Plan eliminated disability after age 55 and reduced benefit calculation for those under 55 (active after May 31, 2013).
column4:
Total Disability.
15 years Vesting Service.
Age 55 to 65.
Must file application.
Oakland Plan participants have different legacy rules.
column5: **None.** The Plan explicitly states it does not provide a Disability Benefit.

column2: Equal to Regular Pension Benefit earned to date. (2017 Amendment removed exclusions for mental/emotional/substance abuse conditions).
column3:
**Pre-Rehab Plan:** Normal Retirement Benefit with no reduction.
**Post-Rehab Plan:** Actuarial equivalent of Age 55 early retirement benefit.
column4: Same monthly amount as Normal Pension determined at time of disability.

column2:
**Past Service (1964-1970):** $11.00/year.
**Future Service:** Based on hours worked (e.g., 2000+ hrs = $37.83/mo).
**Increase:** 10% increase for all active participants on/after Jan 1, 2016.
column3:
**Pre-2010:** 2.5% of contributions.
**Post-June 2010:** 1.0% of contributions.
**Rehab Plan:** 2013 Plan mandated contribution increases with no benefit accrual on the additional contributions.
column4:
**Standard:** Varies by year (e.g., $25.00 or $18.80 depending on contribution rate).
**Window Benefits (IV, V, VI, VII):** Flat dollar amount per year of service (e.g., $50/year for Window VII) if retiring within specific window periods.
column5:
**Past Service:** $1.00/mo per year.
**Future Service:** Varies by year (e.g., 1983-2007 = 3.33% of contributions; May 2019+ = dependent on Funded Percentage, ranging from 0.50% to 1.60% of contributions).

column2:
**Break:** Working less than 300 hours in a calendar year.
**Permanent Break:** Loss of all prior benefits if breaks equal prior service years.
column3:
**Break:** Working less than 400 hours in a Plan Year.
**Permanent Break:** 5 consecutive one-year breaks (for non-vested).
column4:
**Break:** Less than 500 Hours or 4 months Vesting Service in a Plan Year.
**Permanent Break:** If consecutive breaks equal greater of vesting service or 5 years.
column5:
**Break:** Less than 300 Hours in a Plan Year (post-1996).
**Cancellation:** If consecutive breaks exceed greater of 5 years or total previous service credits.

column3: **Vested:** 50% Spouse Option effective at participant's earliest retirement date; or Single sum payment of at least 36x monthly benefit.
column4: **Vested:** 50% Pre-Retirement Survivor Annuity (one-half of what participant would have received if retired with Joint Pension).
column5:
**Vested:** 50% Qualified Joint and Survivor Annuity (can be deferred).
**Unmarried/Vested:** Lump sum of contributions (max $5,000) if >1,000 hours worked.

column2:
**Married:** 50% Joint & Survivor Annuity (with Pop-Up).
**Single:** Life Annuity with 36-Month Guarantee (or 50% Lump Sum Option).
column3:
**Married:** 50% Joint & Survivor Annuity (with Pop-Up).
**Single:** Modified Life Annuity (36-month guarantee).
column4:
**Married:** 50% Qualified Joint & Survivor Annuity.
**Single:** Life Annuity (no guarantee mentioned in basic summary, but Oakland Plan had 10-year certain option).
column5:
**Married:** 50% Qualified Joint & Survivor Annuity.
**Single:** Life Annuity with 36-Month Guarantee.

column2: **Hours Restoration:** 2020 hours automatically increased to match 2019 hours to prevent breaks in service.
column3: None explicitly listed in provided documents.
column4: **Vesting:** Participants active as of April 1, 2020 (not yet vested) received 1 Year Vesting Service for Plan Year ending March 31, 2021 regardless of contributions.
column5: **Deadlines:** "Outbreak Period" (March 1, 2020 + 60 days after National Emergency end) disregarded for claims filing and appeals deadlines.

column3: Not explicitly detailed in updates provided.
column5: Increased from Age 70½ to Age 72 effective for participants reaching 70½ on/after Jan 1, 2020.

column3: **Critical Status (2012):** Adopted Rehabilitation Plan in 2013. Included "Preferred" and "Default" schedules for contribution increases and benefit reductions (e.g., elimination of 36-month guarantee).
column5: Funding status determines accrual rate (e.g., if funded % < 80%, accrual is 0.50% of contributions).

column4:
**Window VII:** $50/year benefit if retiring April 2019–April 2023 (4-Year) or April 2025 (6-Year).
**Special Window VI:** $45/year benefit if retiring Oct 2021–Oct 2026.
